These words are adverbs or adverbial phrases that mean at a slow speed or rate. The most commonly used word for this is slowly . You can also use the word slow in combination with other words to describe a thing that happens slowly. I got out of bed and walked slowly to the door. Shock and disbelief slowly turned to anger. Go slower! I can't keep up. We're stuck in slow-moving traffic. The opposite of slowly is quickly . Shut the door quickly. For more opposites of slowly , see the article at fast . You can say that something moves or happens at a slow pace or at a slow speed , or that something changes, increases, develops, etc. at a slow rate . They are easy hikes, done at a slow pace. You only have to hit a pedestrian at a slow speed to kill them. The economy grew at a slower rate during the second half of the year. Steadily means moving or happening in a smooth and regular way, not fast. We walked steadily past the crowd. His work has been improving steadily all year. You can say that something happens gradually if it happens or changes slowly, over a long period of time. Little by little can also be used A cat's diet should always be changed gradually to avoid digestive upsets. Little by little, we're getting results. If you do something step by step , you do it one thing at a time, in a fixed order, and without hurrying. It's a lot easier to understand if you do it step by step. Progressively is a more formal word than gradually . It is often used with comparatives. My eyesight has got progressively worse over the years.

If someone or something moves at a low speed or takes a long time to happen, you can call that person or thing slow . Things that happen or are done slowly happen at a slow speed. You can also talk about moving slowly , or getting slower .

If you are able to do something, you have the necessary physical strength, mental power, skill, time, money, or opportunity to do it. I wasn't able to work out what she was trying to say. Can has a similar meaning and is more common than able to in speech and writing. Can you make out what she is trying to say? The opposite of and able is unable . I was unable to get the lid off the jar. You can say that a person or group is capable of something or is capable of doing something. You are capable of a lot more than you think you are. I didn't think he was capable of doing that. The opposite of being capable of (doing) something is being incapable of (doing) something. He was incapable of putting a coherent sentence together. If you know how to do something, you have learned how to do it. "Do you know how to swim?" "Of course I know how to swim."

These words refer to the fact of someone being able to do something. Ability can be used in most situations. It is followed by to with an infinitive. She's reached the point in her career where she has the ability to do whatever she wants. He's a great player because he has the ability to see what's coming. Capacity and capability are more commonly used in writing. Do you think he has the capacity to do the work? The tests show that the disease is not affecting her mental capacity. These small villages don't have the capabiltiy to host the Olympics. The opposite of ability is inability . His inability to settle down in a job was holding him back.
She's reached the point in her career where she has the ability to do whatever she wants.
He's a great player because he has the ability to see what's coming.
Do you think he has the capacity to do the work?

These small villages don't have the capabiltiy to host the Olympics.
His inability to settle down in a job was holding him back.

These words mean to say that you want something. Ask for is the most common way of saying this. I asked the waiter for another glass. If you request something, you ask for it politely or officially. Request is a formal word. The department has requested permission to spend money on new equipment. If you apply for something, you request it officially, usually in writing or by sending in a form. We applied for planning permission to build an extension. If you demand something, you ask for it forcefully, in a way that shows that you expect to get what you want. People are demanding the right to return to their homes. If you appeal for something, or call for it, you make a serious or formal request, especially to the public. The prime minister appealed for calm. A group of religious leaders are calling for an end to racism and injustice in the city. If you claim something, you ask for it because you think it belongs to you or because you think you have a right to it. The protestors claim the right to walk freely through the countryside. If you beg for something, you make a very strong and urgent request for it. By the end of the show the audience was begging for more. For more synonyms of beg , see the article at beg .
I asked the waiter for another glass.
The department has requested permission to spend money on new equipment.
We applied for planning permission to build an extension.
People are demanding the right to return to their homes.
The prime minister appealed for calm.
A group of religious leaders are calling for an end to racism and injustice in the city.
The protestors claim the right to walk freely through the countryside.
By the end of the show the audience was begging for more.

These words mean to ask for someone to come to you. The most common word for this, and the one with the broadest use, is call . Call is usually used with a preposition or adverb. The children called for him at night. I'm sorry, I've just been called into a meeting. She called me over. If you contact someone, such as a doctor or another person who provides a service, and ask them to come to you to fix a problem, you can call them out or send for them. Please avoid calling out the doctor unless it is an emergency. I need to call out a plumber to fix this leaking tap. Someone has already sent for a doctor. Summon is more formal and is used when someone is ordered rather than asked to come. I was summoned to the headmaster's office. The verb summons means to order someone to appear in a court of law. Summons is usually used in the passive. If you are summonsed and do not attend court, you may be found guilty of contempt of court. If you hail a taxi in the street, you put out your arm or make a movement to make its driver stop for you. She walked to the corner and hailed a cab.
The children called for him at night.
I'm sorry, I've just been called into a meeting.
She called me over.
Please avoid calling out the doctor unless it is an emergency.
I need to call out a plumber to fix this leaking tap.
Someone has already sent for a doctor.
I was summoned to the headmaster's office.
If you are summonsed and do not attend court, you may be found guilty of contempt of court.
She walked to the corner and hailed a cab.

These words mean to not allow yourself to do or be involved in something. The most commonly used word is avoid . Avoid swimming in areas where sharks are known to congregate. If someone evades something, they manage to avoid or escape from it. This is a formal word, and is often used to talk about avoiding doing what you should do, or avoiding fair punishment for what you have done. Please don't think I'm trying to evade my responsibility. Dodge is a more informal word meaning evade . He tried to dodge his military service. You can say that someone runs away from or, especially in writing and more formal spoken contexts, shrinks from a problem or difficult situation. These expressions are often used in negative sentences. I didn't often run away from difficult decisions. I've never been one to shrink from a challenge. If you sidestep or shirk a duty or responsibility, you avoid it. Shirk is a disapproving word. This is not a responsibility you can sidestep. Some Democrats have accused him of shirking his duty. If you skip or miss something that you usually do or that you have arranged to do, you avoid doing it. Skip is informal. Is your child skipping school? Depressed patients often miss therapy appointments. If you get out of something unpleasant, such as a job you are supposed to do, you manage to avoid it. I managed to get out of washing-up duties.
Avoid swimming in areas where sharks are known to congregate.
Please don't think I'm trying to evade my responsibility.
He tried to dodge his military service.
I didn't often run away from difficult decisions.
I've never been one to shrink from a challenge.
This is not a responsibility you can sidestep.
Some Democrats have accused him of shirking his duty.
Is your child skipping school?
Depressed patients often miss therapy appointments.
I managed to get out of washing-up duties.

These words mean to stay away from someone or something. The most commonly used word is avoid . Have you been trying to avoid me? I had to swerve to avoid an oncoming car. You can also steer clear of , or keep or stay clear of someone or something. These expressions are more common in speech and less formal writing. You can also stay away from someone or something. I suggest steering clear of yellow snow. Keep clear of her - she's got flu. Stay clear of the sun and use sunscreen every day. The experience was so bad that she stayed away from men for two years. If someone shuns a particular lifestyle, they deliberately avoid it or anything connected with it. If someone shuns a person, they avoid them or do not speak to them because of their behaviour, beliefs, etc. The best companies are run by people who shun the limelight. You'll be shunned and totally isolated if you don't join in. For words meaning to deliberately pay no attention to someone, see the article at ignore .
Have you been trying to avoid me?
I had to swerve to avoid an oncoming car.
I suggest steering clear of yellow snow.
Keep clear of her - she's got flu.
Stay clear of the sun and use sunscreen every day.
The experience was so bad that she stayed away from men for two years.
The best companies are run by people who shun the limelight.
You'll be shunned and totally isolated if you don't join in.

You can say that a book, film, etc. is about something. What is the story about? You can say that something is, has, or has got to do with something else. What's that got to do with it? The condition has to do with genetics. A lot of it is to do with attitude. If something relates to something else, that means that it is connected to that other thing in some way. That relates to what I was saying earlier about the need for reform. Concern is a formal way of saying that something is about something else. The film concerns the complicated nature of marriage. Cover , deal with , and treat are normally used in connection with presenting facts. Treat is more common in the passive with this meaning. We will cover the passive voice later in the course. We will deal with the use of antidepressants in chapter three. There is too much variety in how the election results are treated by different newspapers. If a piece of writing refers to something, it mentions it but does not necessarily give much detail about it. I briefly referred to this study in my introduction. If a piece of writing discusses something, it goes into detail about it and analyses it from different points of view. The final chapter will discuss the relevance of these findings for clinical practice.
What is the story about?
What's that got to do with it?
The condition has to do with genetics.
A lot of it is to do with attitude.
That relates to what I was saying earlier about the need for reform.
The film concerns the complicated nature of marriage.
We will cover the passive voice later in the course.
We will deal with the use of antidepressants in chapter three.
There is too much variety in how the election results are treated by different newspapers.
I briefly referred to this study in my introduction.
The final chapter will discuss the relevance of these findings for clinical practice.

Something or someone that is absent is not in the place you are talking about. You can also use absent when something is not in a place that you expect it to be. If you are absent from work for more than three days, you must provide a medical certificate. Any sign that he was surprised by my news was completely absent. When someone is AWOL , or absent without leave , they have left the place where they are supposed to be without permission. This expression is used of soldiers. During the First World War soldiers who left their post were regularly charged with going AWOL. In humorous language, you can also say that someone or something has gone AWOL when you cannot find them in their usual place. My glasses have gone AWOL again. In most contexts, when something is not in its place, you can say that it is not there or not here . You can also say that it is missing . I went to get my keys out of my handbag but they weren't there. Is this where the money's supposed to be? Because it isn't here. Have you seen my credit card? It seems to be missing. If you are conspicuous by your absence , you are absent in a way that people notice. The host's wife was conspicuous by her absence - where was she? The opposite of absent is present . All course members were present on the first day, but attendance gradually dropped off.
If you are absent from work for more than three days, you must provide a medical certificate.
Any sign that he was surprised by my news was completely absent.
During the First World War soldiers who left their post were regularly charged with going AWOL.
My glasses have gone AWOL again.
I went to get my keys out of my handbag but they weren't there.
Is this where the money's supposed to be? Because it isn't here.
Have you seen my credit card? It seems to be missing.
The host's wife was conspicuous by her absence - where was she?
All course members were present on the first day, but attendance gradually dropped off.

You can say that you are descended from a particular ancestor or group of ancestors. I'm descended from a French-Canadian merchant. He didn't know he was descended from Argentinians. You can also say that you trace your ancestry or origins back to a particular person, place, or time, or that your family goes back to a particular time or place. I can trace my ancestry back to the Victorian era. We traced our origins back to Ireland. Our family name goes back to the time of William the Conqueror. One branch of his family goes back to the 1600s.

He didn't know he was descended from Argentinians.
I can trace my ancestry back to the Victorian era.

Our family name goes back to the time of William the Conqueror.
One branch of his family goes back to the 1600s.

These expressions mean to be very expensive or to be too expensive. In informal English, if you say that something costs a (small) fortune or costs an arm and a leg you mean that it is extremely expensive. This trip cost a fortune. Taking the kids to the zoo cost a small fortune. Drinks at that club cost an arm and a leg. If you think that something is not worth its expensive price can say in informal UK English that it is daylight robbery , or in informal US English, that it is highway robbery . You can also say that something is a rip-off . What they're charging to get in is daylight robbery. $50 for two drinks? That's highway robbery! Â£200 for a concert ticket is a total rip-off. If something is so expensive that something people cannot do it or buy it, you can say that it is prohibitively expensive . The cost of textbooks alone makes schooling prohibitively expensive for many. If something is so expensive that something people cannot do it or buy it, you can say that it is beyond reach or it is out of reach . The price of this hotel puts it out of reach for most people. These medications are far beyond reach for most of the world's sufferers. If something is too expensive for you, you can say that you can't afford it . This expression is very common. I can't afford to go on holiday this year.

The cost of textbooks alone makes schooling prohibitively expensive for many.
The price of this hotel puts it out of reach for most people.
These medications are far beyond reach for most of the world's sufferers.
I can't afford to go on holiday this year.
